pullRequest.body:
We prove [BGR, Lemma 3.2.1./3][bosch-guntzer-remmert] : if `K` is a normed field with a nonarchimedean power-multiplicative norm and `L/K` is a finite extension, then there exists at least one power-multiplicative `K`-algebra norm on `L` extending the norm on `K`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Thanks for making the changes! This looks great now. I suggested some minor golfs.

```suggestion
  rw [ smul_eq_mul,  smul_eq_mul, algebraMap_smul, map_smul, Finsupp.smul_apply]
```
avoids the "heavy `rfl`" (it always looks a bit fishy to me if there's a rfl after a rewrite, but maybe nobody cares)

```suggestion
/-- For any `K`-basis `B` of `L` containing `1`, `B.norm` extends the norm on `K`. -/
```

My guess is that this PR would be far less painful to write with
```
def norm (x : L) :  := Finset.sup' univ univ_nonempty (fun i :   B.repr x i)
```
which will presumably then mean that you can avoid the many `Classical.choose` hoops which you're currently jumping through.

```suggestion
theorem norm_repr_le_norm {x : L} (i : ) : B.repr x i  B.norm x :=
  Finset.le_sup' (fun i :   B.repr x i) (mem_univ i)
```
(with the new definition)

```suggestion
theorem norm_extends {i : } (hBi : B i = (1 : L)) :
    Extends_map_algebraMap (fun x : K  x) B.norm := fun k  by
  classical
  simp only [norm, repr_algebraMap _ hBi]
  apply le_antisymm
   aesop
   exact le_sup'_of_le _ (mem_univ i) (by simp)
```
(with the new proposed definition of `norm`)

```suggestion
theorem norm_isNonarchimedean (hna : IsNonarchimedean (Norm.norm : K  )) :
    IsNonarchimedean B.norm := fun x y  by
  simp only [Basis.norm]
  obtain i, -, hi := exists_mem_eq_sup' univ_nonempty (fun i  (B.repr (x + y)) i)
  specialize hna ((B.repr x) i) ((B.repr y) i)
  aesop
```
(etc etc)

I know this is a very disruptive suggestion after all the work you've put in, but it looks like it makes the proofs much shorter. What do you think?
This proof works but it is quite slow, so I have pushed one that is closer to the original one (but using the new definition).

```suggestion
    (hna : IsNonarchimedean (Norm.norm : K  )) :
```

You can do it like this:
```suggestion
    obtain k, -, (hk :  i : , (B.repr x i   i_1 : ,
      B.repr y i_1  B.repr (B i * B i_1)) ixy 
      (B.repr x k   j : , B.repr y j  B.repr (B k * B j)) ixy) :=
      IsNonarchimedean.finset_image_add hna'
        (fun i  (B.repr x i   i_1 : , B.repr y i_1  B.repr (B i * B i_1)) ixy)
        (univ : Finset )
```
or if you don't like that, you can still save a bit like this:
```suggestion
    obtain k, hk :  (k : ),
         i : , (B.repr x i   i_1 : , B.repr y i_1  B.repr (B i * B i_1)) ixy 
          (B.repr x k   j : , B.repr y j  B.repr (B k * B j)) ixy := by
      obtain k, -, hk := IsNonarchimedean.finset_image_add hna'
        (fun i  (B.repr x i   i_1 : , B.repr y i_1  B.repr (B i * B i_1)) ixy)
        (univ : Finset )
      exact k, hk
```

Similarly you can just do `obtain k', hk'` here (and drop the `(_ : (univ : Finset ).Nonempty  k'  univ),`) rather than making the first `hk'` and then destructing it on line 134 (which you can now delete). I don't think we lose readability here, this is one thing I like about the `obtain` tactic.
```suggestion
    obtain k', hk' :  (k' : ),
```
Can we get away without making this definition and just use `f  (algebraMap A B) = g` (which is shorter to write!)

pullRequest.title: feat(Analysis.Normed.Ring.FiniteExtension): prove existence of nonarchimedean power multiplicative norm on finite extension
